channel.title: Comments on: Being Better
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description:
Someday...someday, I will make it to Jiro's restaurant!
What do I consider good T-SQL? I like to follow some simple principles, like KISS, and set-based rather than RBAR. If you're looking for learning resources, I recommend Itzik Ben-Gan's <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Microsoft-Server-Fundamentals-Developer-Reference/dp/0735658145/ref=asap_bc?ie=UTF8" rel="nofollow">T-SQL Fundamentals books. </a>
item.content:encoded:
Someday…someday, I will make it to Jiro’s restaurant!

What do I consider good T-SQL? I like to follow some simple principles, like KISS, and set-based rather than RBAR. If you’re looking for learning resources, I recommend Itzik Ben-Gan’s T-SQL Fundamentals books.

item.title: By: SqlKohai
item.dc:creator: SqlKohai
item.description:
I'm curious as to what you would think is good code, and where someone else might be able to view it? I'm dipping my foot back into the sql dev pool and I'm trying to figure out where to start.
I also read from a few sources that Jiro's sushi is ridiculous :)
item.content:encoded:
I’m curious as to what you would think is good code, and where someone else might be able to view it? I’m dipping my foot back into the sql dev pool and I’m trying to figure out where to start.

I also read from a few sources that Jiro’s sushi is ridiculous ðŸ™‚
